recommendations.details: Focus on implementing security best practices and addressing identified vulnerabilities

ssl.subject: veracode.com
ssl.gradeExplanation: Excellent SSL configuration! Protocol: TLSv1.3, Key: 2048 bits, Signature: sha256WithRSAEncryption

tests.name: Certificate Trust
tests.description: Certificate is trusted by the system - Certificate chain is valid and trusted
tests.details: Certificate chain is valid and trusted

tests.name: TLS Protocol Version
tests.description: TLS protocol support analysis - Found: TLSv1.3, TLSv1.2 (modern protocols only)

tests.name: Key Strength
tests.description: Cryptographic key strength analysis - Found: RSA 2048-bit (good)
tests.recommendation: Consider 4096-bit keys or ECC for maximum security

tests.name: Signature Algorithm
tests.description: Certificate signature algorithm analysis - Found: sha256WithRSAEncryption

tests.name: Cipher Suite Strength
tests.description: Evaluates the strength and security of the negotiated cipher suite - Found: TLS 1.3 with 2048-bit key (modern cipher suites)

tests.name: OCSP Stapling
tests.description: Checks if the server supports OCSP stapling for faster certificate revocation checking
tests.recommendation: Enable OCSP stapling to improve SSL handshake performance and provide real-time certificate revocation status.

tests.name: Certificate Transparency
tests.description: Verifies if the certificate is logged in Certificate Transparency logs for enhanced security monitoring

tests.name: SSL/TLS Vulnerability Checks
tests.description: Checks for common SSL/TLS vulnerabilities like Heartbleed, POODLE, and weak protocol support

tests.name: SSL-Related Security Headers
tests.description: Checks for security headers that enhance SSL/TLS security (HSTS, HPKP, Expect-CT)
tests.recommendation: Implement HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security) header to enforce HTTPS connections and prevent downgrade attacks.

summary.explanation: Certificate is functional but has areas for improvement: OCSP Stapling, SSL-Related Security Headers.

headers.name: Strict-Transport-Security
headers.description: Enforces secure HTTPS connections and prevents protocol downgrade attacks
headers.recommendation: Add HSTS header with max-age, includeSubDomains, and preload directives

headers.name: Content-Security-Policy

headers.description: Controls resource loading to prevent XSS and data injection attacks
headers.recommendation: Implement a strict CSP with specific source allowlists

headers.name: X-Frame-Options
headers.description: Prevents clickjacking attacks by controlling iframe embedding
headers.recommendation: Set to DENY or SAMEORIGIN (CSP frame-ancestors is preferred)

headers.name: X-Content-Type-Options
headers.recommendation: Set to nosniff to prevent MIME confusion attacks

headers.name: Referrer-Policy
headers.description: Controls referrer information sent with requests
headers.recommendation: Set appropriate policy for privacy and security

headers.name: Permissions-Policy
headers.description: Controls browser feature access and API permissions
headers.recommendation: Disable unnecessary browser features and APIs

headers.name: X-XSS-Protection
headers.recommendation: Set to "1; mode=block" or "0" if using CSP

headers.name: Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy
headers.recommendation: Set to require-corp for enhanced isolation

headers.name: Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy
headers.recommendation: Set to same-origin for enhanced isolation

headers.name: Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy
headers.recommendation: Set appropriate policy for resource sharing

headers.name: Origin-Agent-Cluster
headers.recommendation: Set to ?1 for enhanced isolation

headers.name: X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies
headers.description: Controls Adobe Flash and PDF cross-domain policies
headers.recommendation: Set to none to prevent cross-domain access

headers.name: X-Download-Options
headers.description: Prevents file downloads from being executed in IE
headers.recommendation: Set to noopen for IE compatibility

headers.name: X-DNS-Prefetch-Control
headers.recommendation: Set to off for privacy-sensitive applications

headers.name: Expect-CT
headers.recommendation: Consider removing as it is deprecated

headers.name: Cache-Control
headers.description: Controls caching behavior for sensitive content
headers.recommendation: Use no-cache, no-store for sensitive pages

headers.name: Pragma
headers.recommendation: Set to no-cache for legacy browser compatibility

headers.name: Expires
headers.recommendation: Set to past date to prevent caching

headers.name: Server
headers.description: Server software information (security risk if detailed)
headers.recommendation: Remove this header: "nginx"

headers.name: X-Powered-By
headers.recommendation: Good - header not present

headers.name: X-AspNet-Version
headers.recommendation: Good - header not present

headers.name: X-AspNetMvc-Version
headers.recommendation: Good - header not present

checks.name: HTTPS Redirect
checks.description: Checks if HTTP requests are redirected to HTTPS
checks.details: HTTP requests properly redirect to HTTPS (301)

checks.name: Mixed Content
checks.description: Checks for insecure resources on HTTPS pages

checks.name: HTTP Methods
checks.description: Checks for potentially dangerous HTTP methods
checks.details: OPTIONS method not allowed (good security practice)
